5.27.24  11:04 am   why do you have two recurring answers, they're like running gags, on this page? they are: "i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes" and "i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite"? like why do you keep saying "i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes" over and over instead of actually coming up with true proper and honest answers? why are those answers specifically the two running gags?

Â Â Â Â Â  first of all, i have more than 2 answers that recur from time to time. over the years with hundreds of thousands of questions, you're going to get that. "i would prefer to make a new one to be my favorite" is my honest answer to anything that asks me to choose a favorite amongst my own songs or videos. i resent the fact that you'd accuse me of being dishonest in that regard. the other one you mentioned, "i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes", is quite often an honest answer. again, i can't think of any reason you'd assume that's dishonest. This is usually the answer i give when i wouldn't have originally thought 'yes', but then after thinking about it for a moment, i realize, for the first time, that i do actually agree with the idea posed in the question. which in most cases would be something new to me at that moment. A small percentage of the use-cases for that answer are also because i just think that answer fits well with the question. sometimes it leaves room for the reader to think about it a little more, considering the implications of both a 'no' and a 'yes' answer, and the transition from one to the other. i find that answer to have a lot of different nuances depending on the question, so that's why i think i get so much mileage out of it

Â Â Â Â Â  step by step. first put 10 together into a centimeter. then, and this is the step that most of us have forgotten about, put 10 centimeters into a decimeter. then of course put 10 decimeters into a meter

5.26.24  5:06 pm   have you noticed any patterns/tendencies that form when a song was made with the melody first, chords second vs a song that was made with chords first and melody second?

Â Â Â Â Â  it's going to be better if you do the melody first, but there's almost no such thing as melody first because the chords are going to materialize immediately along with it also. but to make it even better, the words should go along with it at the same time also. it's best to have it all appear at the same time
